comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Survivors of the Athinai, a ship that was set on fire during WWI. They came home safely on the Tuscania, September 1915. This article: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F60F13FA385B17... Mentions Miss Frances Coffey of Richmond VA among the passengers; the others' names are given as Miss Ruth Eddy, Miss Helen J. Martin, and Miss Edna J. Griffin. Miss Ruth M Eddy (b. 1886) was a member of a large family of Presbyterian missionaries in Syria; she was traveling to Cairo to work as a nurse at an English hospital. In 1937, Ruth Eddy was based in Worcester MA. Her brother was William Alfred Eddy (1896-1962), US Minister to Saudi Arabia in the mid-1940s: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_A._Eddy findingaids.princeton.edu/collections/MC041 www.condit-family.com/ps17/ps17_296.html

comment._content: pennylrichardsca:  Thanks.  We'll include some of your additional information next time we update.
